reviews.review_msg: Gives the impression that your time isn't worth anything by being late to EVERY class.  Very very disorganized and gives the impression that he likes to hear himself talk.  Avoid at all cost.

Brian was not a good prof. He was continually late to every class, and his lectures were very hard to follow. They weren't well related to the readings, but the exam is heavily focused on the readings. He is disorganized (especially with marking). He doesn't have a clear marking scheme; he seems to make it up as he goes.

Not too bad of a class, the lectures were boring but he would make it interesting with jokes sometimes. The TA was extremely nice which also helped with the grades in the class. Over all id only take this class if its a requirement.

hes nice but ta's mark hard on the term paper which determines your grade,&criteria was unclear. classes were lowk boring i didnt go to them but still did good on the exams, just go the week before the midterm/final bc he will explain clearly whats gonna be on them and thats nice. overall not a bad class but didnt boost my gpa cuz of the term paper
Terribly disorganized, has no clear grading scheme, had incorrect info on his slides. He is clearly checked out, waiting for retirement. DO NOT TAKE

Professor Masilamani is an engaging lecturer who breaks down topics well. While attendance is mandatory, the textbook is essential for exam prep. Unstuck Study AI and the TA's tutorials really helped me stay on top of the material.

Papers and exams were fair but expectations weren't clearly explained. Prof cut half of the lectures more than an hour early which was annoying if you live far from SFU and chose to be there for this 8:30am class. Lecture slides are wordy so going to class isn't really necessary. Reading the textbook is mandatory, lot of exam questions from it.

Great lecturer with engaging stories. He is straight to the point & sometimes ends lecture earlier. The TA I had for this course is great & has tutorials that require participation but nothing that is difficult. To get a good grade on the exams, brief over the textbook as the questions are all surface level.

Great prof! clear lectures and breaks topics down to an intro course level. Only downside is he doesn't give outlines for the midterm or final which makes it stressful to study for and that your grade is only based on your final paper, midterm, final and participation which makes everything weighted heavily.

I took Pol Intro with Prof. Logan and he is great, so was our TA. Would recommend him. Lectures are clear and discussion based. Assignments are decent, difficult but doable, if you read textbook & go to lecture.

Prof. Masilamani is easily one of the best profs you can have for your first polisci class. He's incredibly knowledgeable and you can very easily tell he's really passionate about the content. The response time for an email was almost always within hour. On top of this, his tests are super fair. 10/10, and he made me want to minor in polisci
Excellent prof. Lectures were interesting. If you read the text and follow along with his instructions you should be fine.

The second last reviewer still thinks that he/she is in high school. If you have an issue ask a question and Logan will reply to you. Deadlines are deadlines with him. He is wonderful and gets issues across in a sensible manner.

i am in the same class as the last reviewer and I think he/she is not very accurate in the review. Logan does not read off the powerpoints and gives excellent lectures. Follow the instructions and attend lectures and he is great.
Excellent prof only fi you go to his office hours.

Lectures were not mandatory. You have to read the textbook otherwise you will not do good. If you read it depending on your TA (mine was tough grader) you will get at least B+. I did not do very good on my paper still got a B+ overall. Paper is very long (10 pages). Need to put work into it
